medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute epigastric pain radiating around both flanks and to the right shoulder blade.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptom onset occurred two days ago with abdominal pain slightly worse than usual daily epigastric pain associated with GERD. The patient reported severe pain after a small supper of an omelette, worse than any previous pain. Nothing relieved the pain, which radiated to the back and right shoulder blade, and it was slightly worse with breathing. Pain persisted overnight and was relieved slightly after hours of not eating.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Asthma, Type 2 Insulin Dependent Diabetes Mellitus, Gastroesophageal reflux disease, Hyperlipidemia, Hypertension, Peptic ulcer disease, and chronic diseases including fibromyalgia and anxiety.
medical_history.family_history: Mother has a history of cancer and GERD; father died of a blood clot and had intractable hypertension.
medical_history.social_history: Denies alcohol use and has no specified lifestyle factors.
